summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 discussing privilege review of materials from a search warrant database related to Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondents are coordinating with legal teams to identify privileged communications involving Epstein's attorneys and private investigators, specifically mentioning attorney Roy Black and others.

persons.name: Marty Weinberg
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who communicated a list of privilege terms directly to one of the email correspondents in July 2019, when Epstein was still alive.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Listed as one of Epstein's attorneys who likely provided a list of privilege terms to the email correspondent in July 2019.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.context: Listed as one of Epstein's attorneys who likely provided a list of privilege terms to the email correspondent in July 2019.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.role: Attorney for Jeffrey Epstein / Private Investigator
persons.context: Discussed as both a potential private investigator and confirmed as Epstein's attorney from the firm Black Srebnick Kornspan & Stumpf. Emails referencing him were found in the search warrant database.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: Identified as representing the co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, along with Marc Weinstein. His email address is provided in the correspondence.

persons.name: Marc Weinstein
persons.context: Identified as representing the co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, along with Andrew Tomback. The email asks if others have been dealing with him.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Named as one of the co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, represented by attorneys Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: His email address was flagged for privilege review in the search warrant database, as he represented Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the search warrant database and privilege review. Referenced in the context of his attorneys and estate.

connections.description: Roy Black is identified as an attorney who represented Jeffrey Epstein.
Marty Weinberg is listed as one of Epstein's attorneys who communicated privilege terms.
Reid Weingarten is listed as one of Epstein's attorneys who communicated privilege terms.
Michael Miller is listed as one of Epstein's attorneys who communicated privilege terms.
Jack Goldberger is identified as an attorney who represented Epstein.
Andrew Tomback represents Darren Indyke, a co-executor of the Epstein estate.
Marc Weinstein represents Darren Indyke, a co-executor of the Epstein estate.
Both are listed together as attorneys for Jeffrey Epstein who communicated privilege terms.

events.title: Privilege Terms Communication
events.description: Epstein's attorneys (Marty Weinberg, Reid Weingarten, and/or Michael Miller) communicated a list of privilege terms directly to a government correspondent, prior to Epstein's death.

events.title: Search Warrant Database Review
events.description: A privilege review is being conducted on a database of materials obtained from a search warrant related to Jeffrey Epstein. The review aims to identify communications involving attorneys and private investigators that may be protected.

keyFacts: The email chain reveals a post-Epstein death (2020) privilege review of a search warrant database, indicating ongoing legal and investigative processes related to his case.
It clarifies that attorney Roy Black represented Jeffrey Epstein and that references to 'Roy Black' in the database are likely to him, not a separate private investigator.
The correspondence indicates Epstein hired private investigators in connection with prior criminal investigations and civil litigation in Florida.

Multiple layers of legal representation are documented: Epstein's personal attorneys (e.g., Weinberg, Weingarten, Miller, Black, Goldberger) and the attorneys for his estate's executors (Tomback and Weinstein).
The review process was sensitive enough that the case team was not included on direct communications between government reviewers and Epstein's attorneys.
